passages.subtitle: A tale from the Panchatantra¹
passages.author: Retold by Santhini Govindan
passages.content: [PASSAGE TEXT TO BE UPLOADED: The Unwelcome Neighbor, paragraphs 1-13]

passages.title: Mission Blue
passages.content: [PASSAGE TEXT TO BE UPLOADED: Mission Blue, paragraphs 1-12]

passages.title: Cheese for Dinner
passages.subtitle: A Tale from Mexico
passages.author: by Judy Goldman
passages.content: [PASSAGE TEXT TO BE UPLOADED: Cheese for Dinner, paragraphs 1-18]

passages.title: Book Clubs Are for Everyone!
passages.content: [PASSAGE TEXT TO BE UPLOADED: Book Clubs Are for Everyone!, paragraphs 1-7]

passages.title: The Rescue
passages.author: by Laura Sassi
passages.content: [PASSAGE TEXT TO BE UPLOADED: The Rescue, lines 1-16]

questions.question: What does the word snatched mean in paragraph 11?
options: Hid
Tossed
Broke
Grabbed
questions.correctAnswer: Grabbed

questions.question: Why is the fox's plan important to the resolution of the story?
options: The plan helps the crows learn how much they like their home.
The plan causes the snake to move away from the tree.
The plan gives the snake a chance to find an important necklace.
The plan proves to the crows that they like attention.
questions.correctAnswer: The plan causes the snake to move away from the tree.

questions.question: What can the reader infer about the crows based on their actions after Father Crow talks to the fox?
options: They worry that the snake will harm the servants.
They often visit the royal ladies and servants at the river.
They want to give the necklace to the fox.
They trust the fox and the plan he shares.
questions.correctAnswer: They trust the fox and the plan he shares.

questions.question: What key idea about Mother Crow do the details in paragraphs 7 and 8 best support?
options: Mother Crow is worried about the snake that is living in the tree.
Mother Crow is afraid that she will not find enough food for her babies.
Mother Crow is sad because the nest is getting too crowded.
Mother Crow is upset because no one is listening to her.
questions.correctAnswer: Mother Crow is worried about the snake that is living in the tree.

questions.question: How is the setting of the river important to the plot of the story?
options: The river is where Mother Crow wants to build a nest.
The river is where Father Crow meets with the fox.
The river is where Mother Crow picks up the necklace.
The river is where Father Crow wants the snake to live.
questions.correctAnswer: The river is where Mother Crow picks up the necklace.

questions.question: Look at this illustration. What is the most likely reason the author includes this illustration in the story?
options: To show an important part of the fox's plan
To show how the crows build their nest in the banyan tree
To show why the snake moves into the banyan tree
To show that the crows need the fox's help in order to stay safe
questions.correctAnswer: To show an important part of the fox's plan

questions.question: Which key idea do the details in paragraphs 11 and 12 support about the goals of Mission Blue?
options: Young people can do their part to help oceans.
Storms may cause some problems for oceans.
Schools should teach young people about oceans.
Taking care of oceans requires several talents.
questions.correctAnswer: Young people can do their part to help oceans.

questions.question: In paragraph 6, the prefix un- helps the reader understand that unharmed means —
options: harmed again
able to harm
full of harm
not harmed
questions.correctAnswer: not harmed

questions.question: What can the reader conclude about Mission Blue from information throughout the selection?
options: Mission Blue wants more people to travel to oceans.
Mission Blue plans to stop people from fishing in oceans.
Mission Blue wants all its volunteers to be scientists.
Mission Blue values teaching people about oceans.
questions.correctAnswer: Mission Blue values teaching people about oceans.

questions.question: In paragraphs 5 and 6, which key idea do the details support about why Mission Blue divides the ocean into small areas called "hope spots"?
options: These areas are easier to reach by boat.
These areas have the deepest waters.
These areas are easier to care for.
These areas have very few visitors.
questions.correctAnswer: These areas are easier to care for.

questions.question: What is the most likely reason the author wrote this selection?
options: To inform the reader about the work of Mission Blue members
To persuade the reader to visit oceans
To teach the reader about plant life in oceans
To tell the reader where Mission Blue members meet
questions.correctAnswer: To inform the reader about the work of Mission Blue members

questions.question: Based on the information in paragraph 9, what can the reader infer about why members of Mission Blue enjoy working with scientists?
options: Scientists care more about protecting oceans than other people do.
Scientists take the best pictures of animals and plants.
Scientists know how to use boats and machines.
Scientists have knowledge about which ocean plants or animals need help.
questions.correctAnswer: Scientists have knowledge about which ocean plants or animals need help.

questions.question: How does the author organize the selection?
options: By explaining problems happening in oceans and the work Mission Blue does to solve the problems
By describing in chronological order the actions that Mission Blue has taken to help oceans
By providing the causes of problems in the ocean and effects of the different ways Mission Blue helped with the problems
By describing mysteries of the oceans and how Mission Blue plans to learn more about oceans
questions.correctAnswer: By explaining problems happening in oceans and the work Mission Blue does to solve the problems

questions.question: Based on the section "Beyond the Ocean," what can the reader infer about Mission Blue members?
options: They are more interested in events for students than events for scientists.
They want more people to help with the team's goals.
They plan to start identifying hope spots on land.
They are famous because of the organization's successes.
questions.correctAnswer: They want more people to help with the team's goals.

questions.question: What is the central idea of the selection?
options: Oceans are in trouble because sea life is disappearing.
Sylvia Earle is a scientist who loves studying all ocean life.
The group Mission Blue works in different ways to care for oceans.
The group Mission Blue wants to save the plants in the oceans.
questions.correctAnswer: The group Mission Blue works in different ways to care for oceans.

questions.question: How can Conejo's relationship with Coyote best be described in paragraphs 6 through 11?
options: Conejo pretends to want to help Coyote.
Conejo is unsure if he should trust Coyote.
Conejo is worried that Coyote is unhealthy.
Conejo enjoys spending time with Coyote.
questions.correctAnswer: Conejo pretends to want to help Coyote.

questions.question: What is the meaning of the word sly in paragraph 16?
options: Small
Quick
Clever
Friendly
questions.correctAnswer: Clever

questions.question: What key idea about Coyote is supported by the details in paragraphs 10 through 12?
options: Coyote believes that he will enjoy eating a giant wheel of cheese.
Coyote is tired of chasing Conejo.
Coyote howls at the moon when he is hungry.
Coyote likes to sneak up on Conejo.
questions.correctAnswer: Coyote believes that he will enjoy eating a giant wheel of cheese.

questions.question: Look at this illustration. What is the most likely reason the author includes this illustration in the story?
options: To help the reader understand that Conejo is worried about Coyote
To show that Coyote has chased Conejo many times
To help the reader understand why Coyote believes there is cheese in the lake
To show that Conejo is just as hungry as Coyote
questions.correctAnswer: To help the reader understand why Coyote believes there is cheese in the lake

questions.question: Based on the events at the end of the story, what can the reader predict about Coyote?
options: Coyote will not trust Conejo again.
Coyote will no longer try to swim in the lake.
Coyote will find a way to get the cheese.
Coyote will discover Conejo in his burrow.
questions.correctAnswer: Coyote will not trust Conejo again.

questions.question: In paragraph 1, the word cloudless includes the suffix -less. The suffix helps the reader understand that cloudless means —
options: close
clear
dark
scary
questions.correctAnswer: clear

questions.question: Which sentence best describes Coyote's relationship with Conejo by the end of the story?
options: Coyote is eager to find Conejo so they can become better friends.
Coyote is grateful to Conejo for showing where to find cheese.
Coyote is angry with Conejo because he has a comfortable place to live.
Coyote is upset with Conejo for saying something that was untrue.
questions.correctAnswer: Coyote is upset with Conejo for saying something that was untrue.

questions.question: In paragraph 4, the prefix un- in the word unknown helps the reader understand that the meaning of unknown is –
options: known again
known by many
not known
wrongly known
questions.correctAnswer: not known

questions.question: Which audience is the author addressing in this selection?
options: Students
Parents
Teachers
Librarians
questions.correctAnswer: Students

questions.question: Based on the information in paragraphs 1 through 4, what can the reader conclude about students who join a book club?
options: The students want to start a new book club.
The students belong to several book clubs.
The students develop good reading habits.
The students read more than their parents.
questions.correctAnswer: The students develop good reading habits.

questions.question: Look at these photographs. What is the most likely reason the author includes these photographs in the selection?
options: To show that book-club members have good reading skills
To show that book clubs can meet at different places
To show that book clubs help members choose popular books
To show that book clubs are mainly for adults
questions.correctAnswer: To show that book clubs can meet at different places

questions.question: What sentence supports the idea that joining a book club could help someone make friends?
options: Today more young people are forming their own book clubs. (paragraph 1)
In many book clubs, each member takes a turn selecting the book for the group to read. (paragraph 4)
In many ways, book clubs allow their members to think about new ideas. (paragraph 4)
By spending time with them at book-club meetings, you will get to know all the members better. (paragraph 6)
questions.correctAnswer: By spending time with them at book-club meetings, you will get to know all the members better. (paragraph 6)

questions.question: What opinion does the author include to explain why some students avoid book clubs?
options: Members read the same book. (paragraph 1)
It also helps you understand their meanings. (paragraph 2)
After all the reading you do in school, you may think you don't want to join a book club. (paragraph 4)
Being in a book club allows members to share their thoughts and consider the views of others. (paragraph 5)
questions.correctAnswer: After all the reading you do in school, you may think you don't want to join a book club. (paragraph 4)

questions.question: Which sentence best explains why members of a book club are likely to read a whole book?
options: Reading helps you learn to say new words. (paragraph 2)
The desire to be prepared will encourage you to finish reading what you started. (paragraph 3)
You might already know some members in your book club. (paragraph 6)
All you need are some other members and a place to meet. (paragraph 7)
questions.correctAnswer: The desire to be prepared will encourage you to finish reading what you started. (paragraph 3)

questions.question: What is the most likely reason the poet includes lines 9 through 14?
options: To show that the mother squirrel looks like her babies
To describe why the mother squirrel often changes her mind
To show that the mother squirrel likes to run
To emphasize that the mother squirrel values all of her babies
questions.correctAnswer: To emphasize that the mother squirrel values all of her babies

questions.question: Read lines 6 and 7. What is the most likely reason the poet includes this imagery?
options: To show that the baby squirrel will grow to look like its mother
To suggest that the baby squirrel is sick
To suggest that the baby squirrel is small and helpless
To show that the baby squirrel likes to play games
questions.correctAnswer: To suggest that the baby squirrel is small and helpless

questions.question: What is the most likely reason the poet includes lines 15 and 16?
options: To show that the baby squirrels are safe at last
To show that the baby squirrels need a larger home
To show that the baby squirrels are tired of climbing
To show that the baby squirrels like one another
questions.correctAnswer: To show that the baby squirrels are safe at last

questions.question: How does the windy setting contribute to the poem?
options: The windy setting causes the mother squirrel to become afraid of storms.
The windy setting makes a squirrel family leave the woods.
The windy setting adds a feeling of mystery to the plot.
The windy setting causes a problem the mother squirrel must solve.
questions.correctAnswer: The windy setting causes a problem the mother squirrel must solve.

questions.question: Which line from the poem best shows that the mother squirrel is kind?
options: A gust of wind blew down her nest. (line 2)
With pulsing tail and twitching nose, (line 3)
A baby squirrel just half her size (line 7)
She gently tucks her baby in (line 11)
questions.correctAnswer: She gently tucks her baby in (line 11)

correctAnswer.question:
Read the information in the box below.

A Gallup poll found that Americans are 20 percent happier on weekends than on workdays. Americans also ranked working as one of their least pleasurable activities, while socializing after work was one of their most pleasurable activities.

Although most people must structure their days around school or work, they still prefer their free time.

Think carefully about this statement.

Write an essay explaining the importance of making time for both work and play.
